Failed to usurp wife
Usurped me
Since you had no living sons by [Root.Spouse.GetBestName], on your death her former lands and titles have been returned to her.
Alas.
Since you had no living sons by [From.GetBestName], on his death your lands and titles have been returned to you.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
With the death of [From.GetBestName] without living sons by [Root.Liege.GetBestName], her former lands and titles have been returned to her.
I see.
Since you had no living sons by [Root.Spouse.GetBestName], on your death your former lands and titles have been passed to your legal heir.
Since you have no living sons by [From.GetBestName], on her death her former lands and titles have been passed on to her legal heir.
With the death of [From.GetBestName] without living sons by [From.Spouse.GetBestName], her former lands and titles have been passed to her legal heir, who is now your liege.
Since you had no living sons by [Root.Spouse.GetBestName], on your death her former lands and titles have been returned to her, she is once more your liege, and she is once more independent.
Since you had no living sons by [Root.Spouse.GetBestName], on your death your former lands and titles, once more independent, have been passed to your legal heir, who is now your liege.
On your divorce, your wife's former lands and titles were returned to her.
Your former wife received her lands and titles back.
Upon your divorce from [From.GetBestName], your former lands and titles are being returned to you.
Your former vassals once again swear fealty.
Your former vassals once again swear fealty, and you are once more independent.
Upon [FromFrom.GetBestName]'s divorce from [From.GetBestName], [From.GetBestName]'s dowry lands have been returned to her, and you once more swear fealty to her.
Upon [FromFrom.GetBestName]'s divorce from [From.GetBestName], [From.GetBestName]'s dowry lands have been returned to her, you once more swear fealty to her and she is once again independent.
